paper.title: VeriAbsL: Scalable Verification by Abstraction and Strategy Prediction (Competition Contribution)
paper.abstract: We present VeriAbsL, a reachability verifier that performs verification in three stages. First, it slices the input code using a combination of two slicers, then it verifies the slices using predicted strategies, and at last, it composes the result of verifying the individual slices. We introduce a novel shallow slicing technique that uses variable reference information of the program, and data and control dependencies of the entry function to generate slices. We also introduce a novel strategy prediction technique that uses machine learning to predict a strategy. It uses boolean features to describe a program to a neural network that predicts a strategy. We use the portfolio of VeriAbs, a reachabiltiy verifier with manually defined strategies. In SV-COMP 2023, VeriAbsL verified 227(3) more programs than VeriAbs, and 475(3) programs that VeriAbs could not verify.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要介绍了一种名为VeriAbsL的可达性验证工具，其核心技术涉及程序切片和策略预测，并未提及任何在衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理领域的应用。
